questions.explanation: DNS-based load balancing supports large-scale distribution across multiple headends for high user counts.

questions.text: What are two advantages of using GETVPN to traverse over the network between corporate offices? (Choose two.)
options: A. It has unique session keys for improved security.
D. It is a highly scalable any to any mesh topology.
E. It supports a hub-and-spoke topology.
questions.correct: B. It supports multicast., D. It is a highly scalable any to any mesh topology.
questions.explanation: GETVPN supports multicast traffic and provides scalable any-to-any connectivity without tunnels.

questions.text: Why must a network engineer avoid usage of the default X.509 certificate when implementing clientless SSLVPN on an ASA?
options: A. The certificate must be managed by the local CA.
B. The certificate is regenerated at each reboot.
C. The default X.509 certificate is not supported for SSLVPN.
D. The certificate is too weak to provide adequate security.
questions.correct: B. The certificate is regenerated at each reboot.
questions.explanation: The ASA's default self-signed X.509 certificate regenerates on reboot, causing trust issues for clientless SSLVPN. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security-vpn/webvpn-ssl-vpn/119417-config-asa-00.html

questions.text: An engineer has configured Cisco AnyConnect VPN using IKEv2 on a Cisco IOS router. The user cannot connect in the Cisco AnyConnect client, but receives an alert message 'Use a browser to gain access.' Which action does the engineer take to resolve this issue?
questions.correct: D. Disable the HTTP server.
questions.explanation: Disabling the HTTP server prevents the browser redirect message for IKEv2 AnyConnect connections. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/115755-flexvpn-ike-eap-00.html

questions.text: A router is being configured for IKEv2 AnyConnect using AnyConnect-EAP. How would the administrator separate profiles for administrators and employees so that authorization differs when they connect?
options: A. Define group aliases on the headend and have the user pick the appropriate alias when they connect
B. Define group-urls on the headend and create two XML profiles to match the administrator and user group urls
C. Create a certificate map and match on the appropriate certificate fields
D. Define key-ids on the headend and create two XML profiles to match the administrator and user key-ids.
questions.correct: D. Define key-ids on the headend and create two XML profiles to match the administrator and user key-ids.
questions.explanation: Key-ids with separate XML profiles allow distinct authorization for admins and employees.

questions.text: Which parameter in IPsec VPN tunnel configurations is optional?
questions.correct: D. Perfect Forward Secrecy
questions.explanation: PFS is optional in IPsec configurations, unlike mandatory hash, lifetime, and encryption settings.

questions.text: A company is setting up a dynamic crypto map on the Cisco ASA at the headquarters to accept connections from the branch offices. There will be no IP subnet overlap between the branch offices, but the engineer does not know which encryption domains will be requested by the branch offices. Additionally, the company security policy states that routing protocol traffic should not leave the HQ network. Which solution should be used to route traffic back to the branches from the Cisco ASA with minimal administrative effort?
options: A. Configure Reverse Route Injection on the dynamic crypto map.
B. Configure a default route with the tunneled keyword on all branch routers.
C. Configure static routes for remote subnets.
D. Configure snapshot routing with EIGRP to send out of band routing updates.
questions.correct: A. Configure Reverse Route Injection on the dynamic crypto map.
questions.explanation: RRI automatically injects routes for remote networks, minimizing configuration effort.

questions.text: A network engineer is implementing a FlexVPN tunnel between two Cisco IOS routers. The FlexVPN tunnels will terminate on encrypted traffic on an interface configured with an IP MTU of 1500, and the company has a security policy to drop fragmented traffic coming into or leaving the network. The tunnel will be used to transfer TFTP data between users and internal servers. When the TFTP traffic is not traversing a VPN, it can have a maximum IP packet size of 1500. Assuming the encrypted payload will add 90 bytes, which configuration allows TFTP traffic to traverse the FlexVPN tunnel without being dropped?
options: A. Set the tunnel IP MTU to 1500.
B. Set the tunnel tcp adjust-mss to 1460.
C. Set the tunnel IP MTU to 1400.
D. Set the tunnel tcp adjust-mss to 1360.
questions.correct: C. Set the tunnel IP MTU to 1400.
questions.explanation: TFTP uses UDP, so tcp adjust-mss is ineffective. Setting MTU to 1400 accounts for 90-byte encryption overhead to avoid fragmentation.

questions.text: Which VPN technology minimizes the impact on VPN performance when encrypting multicast traffic on a Private WAN?
questions.correct: D. GETVPN
questions.explanation: GETVPN provides efficient multicast encryption without tunnels, minimizing performance impact.

questions.text: What are two differences between ECC and RSA? (Choose two.)
options: A. Key generation in ECC is slower and more CPU intensive than RSA.
B. ECC can have the same security as RSA but with a shorter key size.
C. ECC cannot have the same security as RSA, even with an increased key size.
D. Key generation in ECC is faster and less CPU intensive than RSA.
E. ECC lags in performance when compared with RSA.
questions.correct: B. ECC can have the same security as RSA but with a shorter key size., D. Key generation in ECC is faster and less CPU intensive than RSA.
questions.explanation: ECC offers equivalent security with shorter keys and faster key generation compared to RSA.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Based on the output of the show run command, which remote access VPN technology is configured?
questions.correct: C. FlexVPN
questions.explanation: The show run output indicates FlexVPN configuration with IKEv2 settings.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Which component must be configured on routers for a GETVPN deployment to work properly?
options: A. PE3: Key Server - Customer 2 CEs: Group Members
B. Customer 1 CE1: Key Server - R1 and Customer 1 CE2: Group Members
C. R1: Key Server - Customer 1 CEs: Group Members
D. PE3: Key Server - all CEs: Group Members
questions.correct: A. PE3: Key Server - Customer 2 CEs: Group Members
questions.explanation: PE3 as key server with Customer 2 CEs as group members is the correct setup for GETVPN.

questions.text: A network administrator deployed IKEv2 Cisco AnyConnect on a Cisco ASA. The current configuration tunnels all traffic through the VPN. Users report poor performance with cloud-based applications, but no issues have been reported about connections to on-premises servers. Packet analysis on Cisco Webex traffic shows very few duplicate ACKs, high RTT, and no IP fragments. Which action improves Webex performance for VPN users?
options: A. Configure QoS on the outside interface of the ASA.
B. Configure Cisco AnyConnect to use DTLS.
C. Configure a dynamic split tunnel exclusion.
D. Reduce the Cisco AnyConnect tunnel MTU.
questions.correct: C. Configure a dynamic split tunnel exclusion.
questions.explanation: Excluding cloud traffic from the VPN via dynamic split tunneling improves performance by avoiding tunnel latency.

questions.text: A network administrator is troubleshooting a FlexVPN tunnel. The hub router is unable to ping the spoke router's tunnel interface IP address of 192.168.1.2, even though the tunnel is showing up. The output of the debug ip packet CLI command on the hub router shows the following entry: IP: tableid=0123456789 s=192.168.1.1 (local), d=192.168.1.2 (loopback2), routed via FIB. What must be configured to fix this issue?
options: A. A matching IKEv2 pre-shared key on the hub and spoke routers in the crypto keyring configuration.
B. An outbound ACL on the dynamic VTI of the hub router that allows ICMP traffic to 192.168.1.2.
C. An IKEv2 authorization policy must be configured on the spoke router to advertise the interface route.
D. A route map must be configured on hub router to set the next hop for 192.168.1.2 to the dynamic VTI.
questions.correct: C. An IKEv2 authorization policy must be configured on the spoke router to advertise the interface route.
questions.explanation: The spoke must advertise its tunnel interface route via IKEv2 authorization policy for reachability.

questions.text: An engineer is implementing the FlexVPN solution on a Cisco IOS router. The router must only terminate VPN requests and must not initiate them. Additionally, the interface must support VPNs from other routers and Cisco AnyConnect connections. Which interface type must be configured to meet these requirements?
questions.correct: D. virtual template interface
questions.explanation: Virtual template interfaces support termination of multiple VPN types, including AnyConnect, without initiating connections.

questions.text: An administrator is setting up Cisco AnyConnect on a Cisco ASA with the requirement that AnyConnect automatically establishes a VPN when a company-owned laptop is connected to the internet outside of the corporate network. Which configuration meets these requirements?
options: A. SBL with user certificate authentication
B. TND with machine certificate authentication
C. SBL with machine certificate authentication
D. TND with user certificate authentication
questions.correct: B. TND with machine certificate authentication
questions.explanation: Trusted Network Detection (TND) with machine certificate authentication auto-connects AnyConnect outside the corporate network. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/vpn_client/anyconnect/anyconnect41/administration/guide/b_AnyConnect_Administrator_Guide_4-1/configure-vpn.html#id_100236

questions.text: Which two protocols does DMVPN leverage to build dynamic VPNs to multiple destinations? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: B. NHRP, C. mGRE
questions.explanation: DMVPN uses NHRP for dynamic address resolution and mGRE for multipoint tunneling to multiple destinations.

questions.text: An engineer is requesting an SSL certificate for a VPN load-balancing cluster in which two Cisco ASAs provide clientless SSLVPN access. The FQDN that users will enter to access the clientless VPN is asa.example.com, and users will be redirected to either asa1.example.com or asa2.example.com. The cluster FQDN and individual Cisco ASAs FQDNs resolve to IP addresses 192.168.0.1, 192.168.0.2, and 192.168.0.3 respectively. The issued certificate must be able to be used to validate the identity of either ASA in the cluster without returning any certificate validation errors. Which fields must be included in the certificate to meet these requirements?
questions.correct: C. CN=asa.example.com, SAN=asa.example.com, asa1.example.com, asa2.example.com
questions.explanation: The certificate must include the cluster FQDN in CN and all FQDNs in SAN to validate both ASAs. Reference: https://integratingit.wordpress.com/2020/03/14/asa-vpn-load-balancing/

questions.text: Over which two transport mediums is FlexVPN deployed? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: C. internet, D. MPLS
questions.explanation: FlexVPN can be deployed over public internet or private MPLS networks for flexible transport. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/routers/asr-1000-series-aggregation-services-routers/data_sheet_c78-704277.html

questions.text: The corporate network security policy requires that all internet and network traffic must be tunneled to the corporate office. Remote workers have been provided with printers to use locally at home while they are remotely connected to the corporate network. Which two steps must be executed to allow printing to the local printers? (Choose two.)
options: A. Configure the split-tunnel-policy on the Cisco ASA to tunnelall.
B. Check the Allow Local LAN access checkbox in the Cisco AnyConnect client.
C. Add a persistent static route in the client OS for the local LAN network.
D. Configure the split-tunnel-policy on the Cisco ASA to excludespecified.
E. Configure the split-tunnel-policy on the Cisco ASA to tunnelspecified.
questions.correct: B. Check the Allow Local LAN access checkbox in the Cisco AnyConnect client., D. Configure the split-tunnel-policy on the Cisco ASA to excludespecified.
questions.explanation: Excluding local LAN traffic and enabling local LAN access allows printing while tunneling other traffic.

questions.text: A network engineer must configure the Cisco ASA so that Cisco AnyConnect clients establishing an SSL VPN connection create an additional tunnel for real-time traffic that is sensitive to packet delays. If this additional tunnel experiences any issues, it must fall back to a TLS connection. Which two Cisco AnyConnect features must be configured to accomplish this task? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: A. DTLS, C. DPD
questions.explanation: DTLS optimizes real-time traffic, and DPD enables fallback to TLS if DTLS fails. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa96/configuration/vpn/asa-96-vpn-config/vpn-anyconnect.html

questions.text: When troubleshooting FlexVPN spoke-to-spoke tunnels, what should be verified first?
options: A. NHRP redirect is enabled on the hub.
B. The spokes have sent a resolution request.
C. NHRP cache entries exist on the spoke.
D. NHO routes exist on the spokes.
questions.correct: B. The spokes have sent a resolution request.
questions.explanation: Spoke-to-spoke tunnels require spokes to send NHRP resolution requests to the hub for direct communication.

questions.text: Users are getting untrusted server warnings when they connect to the URL https://asa.lab from their browsers. This URL resolves to 192.168.10.10, which is the IP address for a Cisco ASA configured for a clientless VPN. The VPN was recently set up and issued a certificate from an internal CA server. Users can connect to the VPN by ignoring the message, however, when users access other webservers that use certificates issued by the same internal CA server, they do not experience this issue. Which action resolves this issue?
options: A. Import the CA that signed the certificate into the machine trusted root CA store.
B. Reissue the certificate with asa.lab in the subject alternative name field.
C. Import the CA that signed the certificate into the user trusted root CA store.
D. Reissue the certificate with 192.168.10.10 in the subject common name field.
questions.correct: B. Reissue the certificate with asa.lab in the subject alternative name field.
questions.explanation: The certificate needs asa.lab in the SAN to match the URL, avoiding trust warnings. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security-vpn/public-key-infrastructure-pki/200339-Configure-ASA-SSL-Digital-Certificate-I.html

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. An engineer has configured two new VPN tunnels to 172.18.1.1 and 172.19.1.1. However, communication between 10.1.0.10 and 10.1.11.10 does not function. Which action should be taken to resolve this issue?
options: A. Remove and reapply the crypto map to the interface.
B. Insert routes for the 10.1.9.0/24 and 10.1.10.0/24 subnets.
C. Modify the transform set to use transport mode.
D. Adjust the network objects to match the appropriate subnets.
questions.correct: D. Adjust the network objects to match the appropriate subnets.
questions.explanation: Incorrect network objects in the crypto ACL cause traffic mismatch; adjust to correct subnets.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A network administrator is setting up Cisco AnyConnect on an ASA headend. When users attempt to connect to the VPN, they are presented with this message. The administrator has replaced the ASA's self-signed certificate with a certificate enrolled with the internal CA and has confirmed that the certificate is not revoked. Which two tasks will the administrator need to do to prevent users from seeing this message? (Choose two.)
options: A. Trust the issuing CA for the ASA identity certificate on the user's PC.
B. Enroll and import an SSL certificate with the CN value example.cisco.com on the ASA.
C. Add the CN example.cisco.com to the AnyConnect XML certificate matching section.
D. Enable certificate authentication under the connection profile.
E. Add example.cisco.com to the server name list within the AnyConnect Local Policy.
questions.correct: A. Trust the issuing CA for the ASA identity certificate on the user's PC., B. Enroll and import an SSL certificate with the CN value example.cisco.com on the ASA.
questions.explanation: Importing the CA certificate and ensuring the CN matches the accessed domain resolves trust issues.

questions.text: Two Cisco ASAs are set up in a VPN load-balancing configuration in an environment where there are thousands of unique Cisco AnyConnect connections per day. Which scalable IP address assignment method must be implemented on both ASAs to achieve minimal overlap when assigning IP addresses from the same subnet to AnyConnect clients?
questions.correct: A. DHCP
questions.explanation: DHCP ensures scalable IP assignment with minimal overlap in load-balanced VPN setups.

questions.text: Which feature must be disabled in EIGRP for DMVPN spokes to learn routes to other DMVPN spokes?
questions.correct: A. split-horizon
questions.explanation: Disabling split-horizon allows spokes to learn routes from other spokes via the hub in DMVPN.

questions.text: Which command must be configured on the tunnel interface of a FlexVPN spoke to receive a dynamic IP address from the hub?
questions.correct: A. ip address negotiated
questions.explanation: 'ip address negotiated' enables the spoke to receive a dynamic IP from the hub via IKEv2.

questions.text: Which configuration allows a Cisco ASA to receive an IPsec connection from a peer with an unknown IP address?
questions.correct: A. dynamic crypto map
questions.explanation: Dynamic crypto maps allow IPsec connections from peers with unknown IPs.

questions.text: An organization wants to implement a site-to-site VPN solution that must be able to support 350 sites with direct communications between all sites, fully encrypt the packet header and payload, and support propagation of routing information over IPsec. Which solution meets these requirements?
questions.correct: D. FlexVPN
questions.explanation: FlexVPN supports large-scale site-to-site connectivity with full encryption and routing propagation. Reference: https://networklessons.com/cisco/ccie-enterprise-infrastructure/flexvpn-ikev2-routing

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Which type of VPN tunnel is configured?
questions.correct: D. GRE over IPsec
questions.explanation: The configuration indicates a GRE tunnel protected by IPsec encryption.

questions.text: A network administrator wants the Cisco ASA to automatically start downloading the Cisco AnyConnect client without prompting the user to select between WebVPN or AnyConnect. Which command accomplishes this task?
options: B. anyconnect ask none default anyconnect
C. anyconnect ask enable default anyconnect
questions.correct: B. anyconnect ask none default anyconnect
questions.explanation: This command auto-initiates AnyConnect download without user prompt.

questions.text: A clientless SSLVPN solution is built for 10 employees on a newly installed Cisco ASA. After a couple of days in production, it has been observed that only the first two users to log in each day are able to connect successfully. The remaining users encounter the message 'Login failed'. Which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Allocate additional Cisco AnyConnect Premium licenses to the ASA.
B. Increase the vpn-simultaneous-logins parameter to a value of more than 2.
C. Increase the number or IP addresses available in the VPN pool.
D. Verify that the users that cannot log in are in the correct AD group with VPN permissions.
questions.correct: A. Allocate additional Cisco AnyConnect Premium licenses to the ASA.
questions.explanation: Clientless SSLVPN requires Premium licenses; default allows only 2 concurrent users.

questions.text: A Cisco IOS router is reconfigured to connect to an additional DMVPN hub that is a part of a different DMVPN phase 3 cloud. After this change was made, users begin to experience problems accessing corporate resources over both tunnels. Before the additional tunnel was created, users could access resources over the first tunnel without any issues. Both tunnels terminate on the same interface of the router and use the same IPsec proposals. Which two actions resolve the issue without affecting spoke-to-spoke traffic in either DMVPN cloud? (Choose two.)
options: A. Enable dead peer detection for both tunnels.
B. Use the same shared IPsec profile for both tunnels.
C. Configure the same NHRP network IDs for both tunnels.
D. Specify the tunnel destination in each tunnel.
E. Assign a unique tunnel key to each tunnel.
questions.correct: D. Specify the tunnel destination in each tunnel., E. Assign a unique tunnel key to each tunnel.
questions.explanation: Unique tunnel keys and specific destinations prevent conflicts between DMVPN clouds.

questions.text: Which remote access VPN technology requires transform sets to be explicitly defined?
questions.correct: B. IPSec
questions.explanation: IPSec VPNs require explicit transform set definitions for encryption and integrity algorithms.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Which action must be taken on the IPsec tunnel configuration to resolve the issue?
options: A. The access lists on each peer must mirror each other.
B. The transform set on each peer must match.
C. The access lists on each peer must be identical.
D. The transform set on each peer must be compatible.
questions.correct: A. The access lists on each peer must mirror each other.
questions.explanation: For IPsec tunnels, the crypto access lists on both peers must be mirrored to correctly match the traffic selectors, ensuring bidirectional traffic encryption.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. The network security engineer identified that the hub router cannot send traffic to the spoke router. Based on the provided output, which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Permit UDP ports 500 and 4500 between the hub and spoke.
B. Correct the next hop server IP address on the spoke router.
C. Ensure the preshared key on the hub-and-spoke router matches.
D. Adjust the ip nhrp network-id command on the hub router.
questions.correct: B. Correct the next hop server IP address on the spoke router.
questions.explanation: Incorrect NHS IP on the spoke prevents hub-to-spoke communication; correcting it resolves the issue.

questions.text: An administrator is deciding which authentication protocol should be implemented for their upcoming Cisco AnyConnect deployment. A list of the security requirements from upper management are: the ability to force AnyConnect users to use complex passwords such as C1$c0451035084!, warn users a few days before their password expires, and allow users to change their password during a remote access session. Which authentication protocol must be used to meet these requirements?
questions.correct: A. LDAPS
questions.explanation: LDAPS with password-management on ASA supports complex passwords, expiration warnings, and password changes. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa97/configuration/vpn/asa-97-vpn-config/vpn-groups.html

questions.text: An engineer is implementing a failover solution for a FlexVPN client site where ESP traffic to the primary FlexVPN server is blocked intermittently after tunnel establishment. This issue causes users at the branch site to lose access to the corporate network. The solution must quickly establish a tunnel and send traffic to the secondary FlexVPN server only during a failover event. Which action must the engineer take to implement this solution?
options: A. Create one tunnel with peer statements to each server and use Dead Peer Detection to track the status or the primary server.
B. Create two tunnels for each FlexVPN server and use the tunnel keepalive command to track the status of each FlexVPN server.
C. Create one tunnel with peer statements to each server and use object tracking to track the status of the primary server.
D. Create two tunnels for each FlexVPN server and use a dynamic routing protocol to track the status or each FlexVPN server.
questions.correct: A. Create one tunnel with peer statements to each server and use Dead Peer Detection to track the status or the primary server.
questions.explanation: DPD enables quick failover to the secondary server by detecting primary server unreachability.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A company has been using SAML to authenticate their clientless SSLVPN users. After about a year of uptime in production, users begin to experience issues authenticating. Based on the collected debugs, which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Increase the SAML Request Timeout value on the ASA.
B. Verify that the IdP is using the SAML-attribute NameID.
C. Ensure that the ASA and IdP are synchronized to a NTP server.
D. Replace the expired IdP signing certificate with a valid one.
questions.correct: C. Ensure that the ASA and IdP are synchronized to a NTP server.
questions.explanation: SAML authentication failures after a year often result from clock skew; NTP synchronization resolves this.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Based on this ASDM output, which remote access technologies are allowed on the ASA?
options: B. IKEv2 and SSL AnyConnect VPN
questions.correct: D. IKEv2 AnyConnect VPN
questions.explanation: The ASDM output shows SSL disabled, allowing only IKEv2 AnyConnect VPN.

questions.text: Which Diffie Hellman group should be used when ECDH is required in a VPN configuration?
questions.explanation: Group 19 is used for Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) in VPN configurations for strong security.

questions.text: On an ASA with multiple connection profiles for different departments, what is the best design to ensure that AnyConnect users are assigned the correct connection profile based on their department and do not have the ability to choose a different connection profile?
questions.correct: A. group URL
questions.explanation: Group URLs automatically assign users to the correct connection profile without user selection.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Which type of VPN is used in the configuration?
questions.correct: C. DMVPN
questions.explanation: The configuration output indicates DMVPN with NHRP and mGRE settings.

questions.text: When deploying a site-to-site VPN, what must be used to minimize IP fragmentation?
questions.correct: D. Path MTU Discovery
questions.explanation: Path MTU Discovery adjusts packet sizes to avoid fragmentation in VPN tunnels.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A network administrator is setting up a phone VPN on a Cisco ASA. The phone cannot connect and the error is presented in a debug on the Cisco ASA. Which action fixes this issue?
options: A. Enable web-deploy of the posture module so that the module can be downloaded from the Cisco ASA to an IP phone.
B. Configure the Cisco ASA to present an RSA certificate to the phone for authentication.
C. Disable Cisco Secure Desktop under the connection profile VPNPhone.
D. Install the posture module on the Cisco ASA.
questions.correct: C. Disable Cisco Secure Desktop under the connection profile VPNPhone.
questions.explanation: IP phones do not support Cisco Secure Desktop; disabling it allows phone VPN connectivity.

questions.text: Which two tasks must be performed to implement a clientless VPN on the Cisco ASA? (Choose two.)
options: C. Install an enrolled X.509 Certificate.
D. Configure a language translation file.
questions.correct: A. Configure a connection profile, C. Install an enrolled X.509 Certificate.
questions.explanation: A connection profile and a valid X.509 certificate are essential for clientless SSL VPN setup.

questions.text: Drag and Drop Question Drag and drop the GET VPN components from the left onto the correct descriptions on the right.
questions.explanation: These are the key components and roles in a GETVPN deployment.

definitions.text: Registers with the key server to get the respective policy and keys
Authenticates the individual GMs that are participating in the group
Defines the policy attributes that are distributed to the GM
Encrypts or decrypts the data traffic
Assists in creating the registration policy and TEK

questions.text: An engineer is creating an URL object on Cisco FMC. How must it be configured so that the object will match for HTTPS traffic in an access control policy?
options: A. Specify the protocol to match (HTTP or HTTPS).
B. Use the FQDN including the subdomain for the website.
C. Use the subject common name from the website certificate.
D. Define the path to the individual webpage that uses HTTPS.
questions.correct: B. Use the FQDN including the subdomain for the website.
questions.explanation: URL objects in FMC use FQDN without protocol prefix to match both HTTP and HTTPS traffic. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/660/configuration/guide/fpmc-config-guide-v66/url_filtering.html

questions.text: A network administrator is deploying a Cisco IPS appliance and needs it to operate initially without affecting traffic flows. It must also collect data to provide a baseline of unwanted traffic before being reconfigured to drop it. Which Cisco IPS mode meets these requirements?
questions.correct: C. promiscuous
questions.explanation: Promiscuous mode allows the IPS to monitor traffic without affecting flows, ideal for baseline collection.

questions.text: A network administrator wants to block traffic to a known malware site at https://www.badsite.com and all subdomains while ensuring no packets from any internal client are sent to that site. Which type of policy must the network administrator use to accomplish this goal?
options: A. Access Control policy with URL filtering
questions.correct: A. Access Control policy with URL filtering
questions.explanation: URL filtering in an Access Control policy blocks specific sites like https://www.badsite.com and subdomains.

questions.text: An engineer must investigate a connectivity issue and decides to use the packet capture feature on Cisco FTD. The goal is to see the real packet going through the Cisco FTD device and see Snort detection actions as a part of the output. After the capture-traffic command is issued, only the packets are displayed. Which action resolves this issue?
options: A. Specify the trace using the -T option after the capture-traffic command
B. Perform the trace within the Cisco FMC GUI instead of the Cisco FMC CLI
C. Use the verbose option as a part of the capture-traffic command
D. Use the capture command and specify the trace option to get the required information
questions.correct: A. Specify the trace using the -T option after the capture-traffic command
questions.explanation: The -T option with capture-traffic enables Snort detection action visibility. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/660/configuration/guide/fpmc-config-guide-v66/packet_capture_and_tracing.html

questions.text: Which configuration sets up spoke-to-spoke dynamic tunnels of FlexVPN?
options: A. The ip nhrp redirect command is needed on the hub router virtual-template interface.
B. The tunnel mode must be IPsec between spoke and hub routers.
C. The transform set mode must be tunnel mode between hub and spoke routers.
D. The ip nhrp nhs command is needed on spoke routers tunnel interface.
questions.correct: A. The ip nhrp redirect command is needed on the hub router virtual-template interface.
questions.explanation: NHRP redirect on the hub enables dynamic spoke-to-spoke tunnels in FlexVPN.

questions.text: Which two dynamic routing protocols work over FlexVPN for failover redundancy? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: D. OSPF, E. EIGRP
questions.explanation: OSPF and EIGRP provide dynamic routing and failover redundancy over FlexVPN tunnels.

questions.text: What are the two AAA methods for user authentication when configuring the IKEv2 profile? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: B. eap, E. pre-share
questions.explanation: IKEv2 profiles support EAP for external AAA server authentication (e.g., RADIUS) and pre-shared keys for manual secret-based authentication.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure a FlexVPN site-to-site GRE tunnel that uses IPsec between two Cisco routers. The indicated configuration was applied on Router_B, but the tunnel fails to come up. Which IP address must be set on Router_B to resolve the issue?
questions.explanation: The configuration on Router_B incorrectly uses 127.0.0.1 as the peer address. It should be set to Router_A's public IP, 192.16.1.1, for IKEv2 negotiation.

questions.text: A network administrator is troubleshooting an IPSec Site-to-Site VPN tunnel on a Cisco ASA firewall. The VPN tunnel is established but is unable to pass traffic between 192.168.10.155 and 192.168.100.172. The administrator observes the log message: %ASA-4-402116: IPSEC: Received an ESP packet (SPI= 0x489041899C, sequence number= 0x9E) from 100.1.1.1 (user= 100.1.1.1) to 12.12.12.12. What must the administrator do to resolve this issue?
options: A. Implement IKE Phase 1 proposal to match other firewall.
B. Confirm that IP address of tunnel interface is correctly configured.
C. Configure ACL for interesting traffic to match remote firewall.
D. Setup identical Pre-shared keys must be on both firewalls.
questions.correct: C. Configure ACL for interesting traffic to match remote firewall.
questions.explanation: The log confirms the tunnel is up, but traffic fails due to mismatched crypto ACLs. Matching ACLs for 192.168.10.155 and 192.168.100.172 are needed.

questions.text: Which command is configured Cisco ASA to allow packets from an IPsec tunnel and the payloads to bypass interface ACLs on the firewall?
questions.correct: B. sysopt connection permit-vpn
questions.explanation: The 'sysopt connection permit-vpn' command allows IPsec VPN traffic to bypass interface ACLs, ensuring tunnel traffic is not blocked.

questions.text: After a network security administrator configures site-to-site IPsec VPN peer, they receive this error message: 1d00h: %CRYPTO-6-IKMP_MODE_FAILURE: Processing of Main Mode failed with peer at 150.150.150.1. What is the solution to this problem?
options: A. ISAKMP policy must match between sites.
B. IPsec policy must match between sites.
C. Crypto map must be applied to correct interface.
D. Transport set must match between sites.
questions.correct: A. ISAKMP policy must match between sites.
questions.explanation: The error indicates an IKE Phase 1 Main Mode failure, typically due to mismatched ISAKMP policies (encryption, hash, authentication, DH group).

questions.text: A network administrator has been handed a VPN configuration with the ip nhrp summary-map command configured. Which type of VPN technology is being used?
questions.correct: C. DMVPN Phase 3
questions.explanation: The 'ip nhrp summary-map' command is specific to DMVPN Phase 3 for summarizing NHRP mappings, enabling efficient spoke-to-spoke routing.

questions.text: What is the default rekey timer for security association pair in the case of IPsec for Cisco ASA?
questions.correct: D. 24 hours
questions.explanation: The default rekey timer for IPsec SAs on Cisco ASA is 24 hours (86,400 seconds).

questions.text: An engineer must design a VPN solution with this criteria: Configured on an IOS XE router. Able to terminate policy-based VPNs from Cisco and non-Cisco devices. QoS can be applied on a per-tunnel basis. Which VPN technology must be used to accomplish this design?
questions.correct: C. Multi-SA VTIs
questions.explanation: Multi-SA VTIs support policy-based VPNs on IOS XE with per-tunnel QoS, compatible with Cisco and non-Cisco devices.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure a FlexVPN site-to-site GRE tunnel that uses IPsec between two Cisco routers. The indicated configuration was applied on Router_A, but the tunnel fails to come up. Which IP address must be set on Router_A to resolve the issue?
questions.explanation: Router_A's configuration uses 127.0.0.1 incorrectly; it should use Router_B's public IP, 192.16.1.2, for IKEv2 negotiation.

questions.text: Which type of VPN technology is being used when the ssl trust-point <trustpoint name> <interface name> command is configured?
questions.correct: C. SSL Remote Access VPN
questions.explanation: The 'ssl trust-point' command specifies the certificate for SSL VPN, used in remote access scenarios like AnyConnect.

questions.text: Which two Java-based components for web browsers in clientless SSL VPN sessions are distributed by Cisco? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: B. RDP2, C. VNC
questions.explanation: Cisco provides RDP2 and VNC Java plugins for clientless SSL VPN to enable remote desktop access.

questions.text: What is the role of a tunnel-group configuration of Secure Client remote-access VPN on Cisco ASA?
options: B. It binds group policy and VPN together.
C. It configures a Secure Client group policy.
D. It provides an IP address pool.
questions.correct: B. It binds group policy and VPN together.
questions.explanation: Tunnel-group links group policies to VPN configurations, defining authentication and connection parameters.

questions.text: A network engineer configured Secure Client VPN for a vendor to provide access to internal resources for a migration project. A pool of 192.168.100.0/28 has been assigned and a local database for user authentications has been configured. An image of Cisco Secure Client Client 4.7 for Windows has also been added. The vendor allocated 10 engineers to the project, and all users were able to connect to the corporate resources. After some time, the vendor added another six resources to the project. After this change, engineers from the vendor reported frequent disconnections. Which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Add the new users to the local database on the ASA.
B. Increase the amount of IP addresses in the pool.
C. Allocate more Cisco Secure Client licenses to the ASA.
D. Upgrade new users to Cisco Secure Client 4.7.
questions.correct: B. Increase the amount of IP addresses in the pool.
questions.explanation: The /28 pool provides 14 IPs; 16 users exceed this, causing disconnections. Expanding the pool resolves this.

questions.text: Which two Secure Client Advantage and Premier models are available for Cisco Secure Client Remote Access VPN? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: D. Secure Client Apex, E. Secure Client Essentials
questions.explanation: Essentials provides basic VPN access, while Apex includes advanced features like posture assessment.

questions.text: An engineer configures the Group URL feature on a Cisco Secure Firewall ASA. The requirement is to place contractors using Cisco Secure Client to access the network into a limited access group. Which information must be referenced in the URL?
questions.correct: D. group-alias
questions.explanation: The Group URL feature uses the group-alias in the VPN URL to assign users to specific tunnel groups with limited access policies.

questions.text: An engineer must design a remote access VPN solution that meets these requirements: supports use by telecommuters on the go, encrypts user connections to the corporate network by using TLS-based tunnels, is client-based. Which VPN technology must be used?
questions.correct: A. Secure Client SSL VPN
questions.explanation: Secure Client SSL VPN (AnyConnect) uses TLS for encryption, is client-based, and supports mobile telecommuters.

questions.text: Two VPN clients have established SSL VPN connections to the outside interface on the same Cisco Secure Firewall ASA, but they cannot communicate with each other. Which CLI command must be entered on the Cisco Secure Firewall ASA to enable this communication?
questions.correct: C. same-security-traffic permit intra-interface
questions.explanation: The 'same-security-traffic permit intra-interface' command enables VPN client traffic to hairpin on the same interface for client-to-client communication.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is configuring remote access VPN on a Cisco IOS router but cannot establish a connection from the Cisco Secure Client client. Which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Use symmetric keys in ikev2 profile.
B. Change Secure Client IKE identity to *$Default$*.
C. Enable crypto ikev2 http-url cert.
D. Replace self-signed certificate with a valid certificate.
questions.correct: D. Replace self-signed certificate with a valid certificate.
questions.explanation: The self-signed certificate (enrollment selfsigned) causes trust issues; a CA-signed certificate is required for IKEv2 connections.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. Users at a site report that they cannot access corporate resources after a maintenance window to replace the older VPN headend router over the weekend. After the replacement, the configuration had to be recreated. To troubleshoot, the engineer ran crypto debugs and saw the given messages. Which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Verify that the same transform set is in use on both VPN routers.
B. Verify that the same preshared keys are in use on both VPN routers.
C. Verify that the same authentication type is in use on both VPN routers.
D. Verify that the same encryption ciphers are in use on both VPN routers.
questions.correct: B. Verify that the same preshared keys are in use on both VPN routers.
questions.explanation: The error '%CRYPTO-4-IKMP_BAD_MESSAGE' indicates a preshared key mismatch during IKE Phase 1.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A network security administrator receives this error message after configuring a site-to-site IPsec VPN between two sites. What is the solution to this problem?
options: A. Transport set must match between sites.
B. IPsec policy must match between sites.
C. ISAKMP policy must match between sites.
D. Crypto map must be applied to correct interface.
questions.correct: D. Crypto map must be applied to the correct interface.
questions.explanation: The error 'IPSEC(validate_proposal): invalid local address 192.168.10.1' suggests the crypto map is not applied to the correct interface.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A customer has a DMVPN establishment problem between a hub and a spoke router. To troubleshoot this problem, the network administrator checks the traffic counters of the tunnel and notices that return traffic is not coming back from the other end of the tunnel. Which solution must be applied on the spoke router?
options: A. Make the tunnel source and destination reachable.
questions.correct: C. Configure the correct NHS.
questions.explanation: The 'req-failed 30 repl-recv 0' output indicates an incorrect NHS configuration on the spoke, preventing registration with the hub.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is troubleshooting a new DMVPN configuration. The network connectivity between the hub and spoke is working as it should, but users cannot access VPN resources. Which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Review ISAKMP packets on devices between the VPN devices.
B. Unblock IP protocol 50 on devices between the VPN devices.
C. Ensure that the IPsec profile is configured on the tunnel interface.
D. Ensure that the NHS is configured on the tunnel interface.
questions.correct: C. Ensure that the IPsec profile is configured on the tunnel interface.
questions.explanation: The 'MM_NO_STATE' in the show crypto isakmp sa output indicates a missing or misconfigured IPsec profile on the tunnel interface.

questions.text: Which state indicates that BFD is missing on a peer when troubleshooting DMVPN?
questions.correct: B. NONE(N)
questions.explanation: The NONE(N) state in DMVPN indicates that BFD is not configured or missing on the peer.

questions.text: A network administrator is setting up a Cisco ASA to authenticate clientless SSLVPN users using an internal Microsoft Active Directory server. When the configuration is complete and the administrator attempts to connect to the clientless SSLVPN, authentication fails. Which action resolves the issue?
options: A. Add the user account the administrator is attempting to log in with to the database.
B. The administrator must use the correct password for the user account they are attempting to log in with.
C. Configure the ASA to connect to the LDAP port being listened to on the Microsoft Active Directory server.
D. Correct the login distinguished name or login password under the aaa-server configuration.
questions.correct: D. Correct the login distinguished name or login password under the aaa-server configuration.
questions.explanation: The error 'Simple authentication for asa.admin@example.com returned code (49) Invalid credentials' indicates an incorrect bind DN or password in the AAA server configuration.

questions.text: Which two tunnel negotiation IKEv2 debug commands are used in Cisco ASA? (Choose two.)
questions.correct: C. debug crypto ikev2, E. debug crypto ikev2 protocol
questions.explanation: The 'debug crypto ikev2' and 'debug crypto ikev2 protocol' commands provide general and detailed IKEv2 debugging on ASA, respectively.

questions.text: Refer to the exhibit. A new IPsec VPN tunnel has been configured and the security associations do not establish. After the show crypto isakmp command is run, the output is displayed. What must be reconfigured to resolve the issue?
questions.correct: C. pre-shared key
questions.explanation: The 'MM_WAIT_MSG_6' state indicates a pre-shared key mismatch, preventing IKE Phase 1 completion.

questions.text: An engineer must force a new IKEv2 security association to be built when using FlexVPN. Which two commands must the engineer apply to meet the requirement? (Choose two.)
options: E. no shut the tunnel interface
questions.correct: B. clear ipsec sa, C. clear isakmp crypto sa
questions.explanation: Clearing IPsec and IKEv2 SAs forces renegotiation of new security associations in FlexVPN.

questions.text: Which interface type must be used in an IKEv2 deployment that needs to route non-IP traffic?
questions.correct: C. GRE interface
questions.explanation: GRE interfaces encapsulate non-IP traffic for IKEv2 VPNs, unlike VTI or DVTI which support only IP traffic.

questions.text: What is a characteristic of GET VPN?
questions.correct: A. tunnel-less
questions.explanation: GET VPN is a tunnel-less technology that encrypts traffic without encapsulation, preserving original routing.
